sections.heading: This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Pre-Filing of Bills Act.
sections.text: This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Pre-Filing of Bills Act.

sections.heading: For the purpose of this Act the following terms have the meanings
A member of the Senate may file a bill by mail or in person,
sections.text:
according to the appropriate rules of the Senate and after the bill has
been approved as to form by the Legislative Reference Bureau, with the
Secretary of the Senate at any time during the filing period. Upon
receiving such bill, the Secretary of the Senate shall immediately cause
such bill to be printed and made available to all members of the General
Assembly and to the public according to the rules and practices in such
matter of the General Assembly next preceding the one for which the bill is
filed.

sections.heading: A member of the House of Representatives may file a bill by mail
sections.text:
or in person, according to the appropriate rules of the House of
Representatives and, after the bill has been approved as to form by the
Legislative Reference Bureau, with the Clerk of the House at any time
during the filing period. Upon receiving such bill, the Clerk of the House
shall immediately cause such bill to be printed and made available to all
members of the General Assembly and to the public according to the rules
and practices in such matter of the General Assembly next preceding the one
for which the bill is filed.

sections.heading: Bills filed during the filing period with the Secretary of the
sections.text:
Senate or the Clerk of the House are deemed automatically introduced on the
opening day of the General Assembly session which next succeeds the last
day of the filing period for such bills.

sections.heading: The expenses of printing of bills pursuant to this Act
sections.text:
shall be paid out of the regular appropriation of the Legislative Printing
Unit.
